ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] send-range: true -> doesn't honor  robots.txt anymore
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi, an equal problem occurs with QuotaEnforcer, it only counts 200 successes in heritrix 1.6.0 ...

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] send-range: true -> doesn't honor
  robots.txt anymore
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=251683900

Hi,

an equal problem occurs with QuotaEnforcer, it only counts "200" 
successes in heritrix 1.6.0 ...

At 18:02 24.04.2006, you wrote:
>Thimo Eichstaedt wrote:
> > Hi,
> >
> > I am using Heritrix 1.6.0. And I have exprienced a strange behaviour:
> >
> > When setting send-range to true, Heritrix doesn't honor the entries
> > in robots.txt anymore ! When setting send-range back to false, it
> > works right.
> >
> > I think it could be related to the response code "206" instead of
> > "200" of the webserver when using the "range" header.
>
>I think you are correct.  Here is where we save off the downloaded
>robots.txt file into the corresponding CrawlServer:
>http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/datamodel/CrawlServer.html#133. 
>
>If the return code is not 200 explicitly, we treat it as equivalent of
>no robots at all and so act as though we have free rein to download all
>of the site.
>
>Looks like we should act as though we got a 200 for at least 203 and
>perhaps a 206.  Meantime, I've made an issue.
>
>Thanks for debugging what was going on as well as the order and seed to
>illustrate the problem.
>
>St.Ack
>
>
>
>Yahoo! Groups Links
>
>
>
>
